result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Tucker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).
  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).
  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically cognitive intervention and vocational training. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Must get GED or HSED.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
